Issues.Title: docs: update deprecated form of the tap operator in http example
Issues.Body:
update deprecated form of the tap operator. Instead of passing separate callback arguments, use an observer argument. Signatures taking separate callback arguments will be removed in v8. Details: https://rxjs.dev/deprecations/subscribe-arguments

DEPRECATED: tap operator subscribe signature is deprecated

Instead of passing separate callback arguments, use an observer argument. Signatures taking separate callback arguments will be removed in v8. Details: https://rxjs.dev/deprecations/subscribe-arguments

Closes #44708

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): properly compile DI factories when coverage reporting is enabled
Issues.Body:
When running tests with code coverage using Istanbul, the code is
instrumented with coverage reporting statements. These statements are
also inserted into synthesized constructors, preventing Angular from
properly recognizing them as synthesized constructor.

This commit changes the regex to detect synthesized constructors to allow
for statements within the constructor before the `super(...arguments);`
call. This is limited to code that does not contain a `}`, but this
is sufficient to support Istanbul's coverage instrumentation statements.

The tests have been extended with an input file that is being
instrumented using `babel-plugin-istanbul` for both ES2015 and ES5
targets, in order to verify that the approach works for real-world
usages.

Fixes #31337
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): properly compile DI factories when coverage reporting is enabled" (#44732)

Issues.Title: Routes with parameter not loaded css and javascript files
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I tried to add a route with parameter but that route didn't worked properly. When I visit the route with parameter javascript and route files couldn't be loaded. There were 404 errors on console.  The other routes were running normal.
After a while, I found the problem **APP_BASE_HREF** provider line. 
I had added   
`providers: [{provide: APP_BASE_HREF, useValue: '/'}`, 

inside AppModule class as a provider. But didn't work at all. So I added 
`<base href="/"> `
tag under head in the index.html file, then it worked.

Issues.Title: refactor(animations): change errors type from any to string
Issues.Body:
errors in the animations code are of type `any` but are consistently
used as if there were `string`s, change `any` to `string` to make
typing more accurate

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## Issue

Issue Number: N/A



## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

I am not completely sure why they were `any`s in the first place, I'd imagine it was done in order to make the code more flexible :thinking: 

Anyways as far I can tell all errors are just strings in the animations code and there are also parts in which getting something different from a string would likely create undesirable results, mainly when combining them together for the generation of an error message, for example like so:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/a92a89b0eb127a59d7e071502b5850e57618ec2d/packages/animations/browser/src/render/timeline_animation_engine.ts#L37

here if errors could be more complex data structures such as objects, when converted to strings by `join` (unless they implement their own `toString`) would just produce `"[object Object]"` which of course would produce a pretty bad error message

Also I don't think this is part of any public api so it should be a safe change to make :slightly_smiling_face:

Issues.Title: make `DebugNode.triggerEventHandler` `eventObj` a proper optional parameter
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

core

### Description

This is to resurrect a change requested here years ago: #10829
The change is minor, but impacts everyone writing tests:
```ts
triggerEventHandler(eventName: string, eventObj: any): void;
```

The current impementation is too terse and forces everyone either to put enything 'sane' or just give up and use whatever quicker, like '{}', including Angular own documentation and test code (this is only from repo code):
```ts
input.triggerEventHandler('keyup', { });
heroDe.triggerEventHandler('click', null);
fixture.debugElement.children[1].triggerEventHandler('myevent', <Event>{});
 ```
 This prevents most adding a quick test for a common code like, again, Angular docs:
 ```html
 <button (click)="save()">Save</button>
 <button (click)="cancel()">Cancel</button>
  ```
 to be tested without switching to additional mode of coding stuff (and adding whatever person writing a code thinks is OK for 'eventObj'). Docs contains special section on 'why' this is required:
https://angular.io/guide/testing-components-scenarios#trigger-event-handler
 
 Thanks!

### Proposed solution

```ts
// as non-transpiled TS
triggerEventHandler(eventName: string, eventObj: any = null): void {
// as declaration type with `eventObj` desribed as `[eventObj=null]`
triggerEventHandler(eventName: string, eventObj?: any): void;
```

If accepted, the change would require review and changes accross different places and documentation, including change to 'Whys' it was added:
https://angular.io/guide/testing-components-scenarios#trigger-event-handler

### Alternatives considered

None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "make `DebugNode.triggerEventHandler` `eventObj` a proper optional parameter" (#44724)

Issues.Title: feat(service-worker): add `cacheOpaqueResponses` option for data-groups
Issues.Body:
Add a new option for configuring data-groups, `cacheOpaqueResponses`, that determines whether opaque responses are cached or not. This allows greater flexibility in configuring the behavior of data-groups, while still keeping the current defaults as fallbacks.

Fixes #44246.

Issues.Title: The click event does not work for list items when *ngFor is used in a certain scenario
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The issue: The click event for standard elements stops working after a module from our @devextreme-angular library is imported to the application. We found out that the problem is reproduced only when *ngFor is used to create items with the click event handlers and a getter/function is used to return an array of objects. For example: ```html
  • {{ b.label }}
``` ```ts get buttons() { return [{ label: "Button1" }, { label: "Button2" }, { label: "Button3" }]; } ``` or ```html
  • {{ b.label }}
``` ```ts getButtons() { return [{ label: "Button1" }, { label: "Button2" }, { label: "Button3" }]; } ``` We found that the issue is not reproducible in the following cases: 1. A getter/function returning an array of numbers, not objects, works correctly. ```ts get numbers() { return [1, 2, 3]; } ``` At the same time, if the array contains both numbers and objects, the issue is not reproducible for numbers and is reproducible for objects: ```ts get numbers() { return [{label:'button1'}, 2, 3]; } ``` 2. If an array is set as a constant: ```ts buttonsArray = [ { label: "Button1" }, { label: "Button2" }, { label: "Button3" } ]; ``` We understand that the problem is related to our library, but it is not clear how to start the research because the following points are unclear: 1. the difference between the code generation when a getter and a constant array are used in *ngFor; 2. how this can be related to the event subscriptions. It will be very helpful if you clarify these (or add some more) details. This will allow us to investigate and resolve the issue on our end. Thanks in advance. An example is included in the code-sandbox ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://codesandbox.io/s/kind-varahamihira-b50dt?file=/src/app/app.component.html ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 9.1.12 Node: 12.14.0 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 9.1.12 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, localize, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, router Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.901.12 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.901.12 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.901.12 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.901.12 @angular-devkit/core 9.1.12 @angular-devkit/schematics 9.1.12 @ngtools/webpack 9.1.12 @schematics/angular 9.1.12 @schematics/update 0.901.12 rxjs 6.6.2 typescript 3.8.3 webpack 4.42.0 ``` ### Anything else? Anything else: The issue is also reproducible in the latest version @angular/cli: 13.1.3.

Issues.Title: `UrlSegmentGroup` constructor error - `Cannot assign to read only property 'parent' of object '[object Object]`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hi ðŸ‘‹ðŸ¼ 

As I was updating Angular from `v11` to `v12` with the help of [update.angular.io](https://update.angular.io/?l=3&v=11.0-12.0) - I noticed that the navigation suddenly stopped working. Based on the stack trace, I've come to this conclusion:

[The part in the `UrlSegmentGroup` constructor where the `parent` files are generated (recursively)](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/6a55affacd9b027b43f898f76e666dcfdbac7863/packages/router/src/url_tree.ts#L238) is now unable to do this because the `parent` property is read-only.

```ts
forEach(children, (v: any, k: any) => v.parent = this);
// ____________________________________^
```

This is executed because I have the following line in my code:

```ts
import { DefaultUrlSerializer } from '@angular/router';

const url = new DefaultUrlSerializer().parse(redirectUrl);
```

The [`DefaultUrlSerializer.parse`](https://angular.io/api/router/DefaultUrlSerializer#parse) method parses the passed string to a `UrlTree`.

Finally, once I pass the previously generated `UrlTree` to [`router.navigateByUrl`](https://angular.io/api/router/Router#navigatebyurl) - this exception gets raised.

---

When I downgrade to `v11` - everything is correct. âœ… 

> Note: There's a huge chance I'm missing something in the process, but from what I've concluded looking at the stack trace - it seems like an Angular regression.

Thanks in advance! ðŸ™ŒðŸ¼ 

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'parent' of object '[object Object]'
TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'parent' of object '[object Object]'

    at forEach (router.js:572:13)
    at new UrlSegmentGroup (router.js:755:9)
    at split (router.js:2493:15)
    at ApplyRedirects.apply (router.js:2619:28)
    at applyRedirects (router.js:2607:93)
    at SwitchMapSubscriber.project (router.js:2952:27)
    at SwitchMapSubscriber._next (switchMap.js:28:27)
    at SwitchMapSubscriber.next (Subscriber.js:49:18)
    at SwitchMapSubscriber.notifyNext (switchMap.js:66:26)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:1213:31)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:1167:17)
    at zone.js:1279:17
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:406:31)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (core.js:28679:33)
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:405:60)
    at Zone.runTask (zone.js:178:47)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone.js:582:35)
    at ZoneTask.invokeTask [as invoke] (zone.js:491:21)
```

Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): enable extended diagnostics by default
Issues.Body:
This is just a flag flip to enable extended diagnostics in production for v13.2. It swaps out `_extendedTemplateDiagnostics` for `strictTemplates`, since strict templates are required anyways. The commit message includes a deeper discussion of the feature just to give users something useful in release notes.

Extended template diagnostics provide additional analysis about Angular templates by emitting warnings for specific patterns known to be error prone or cause developer confusion. Currently, there are two such diagnostics which are enabled by default:

* `invalidBananaInBox` emits a warning if a user writes a two-way binding backwards like `([foo])="bar"`, when they actually wanted `[(foo)]="bar"`.
* `nullishCoalescingNotNullable` emits a warning if a binding attempts to perform nullish coalescing (`??`) on a type which does not include `null` or `undefined`, such as `{{ foo ?? 'bar' }}` where `foo` is defined as `string` instead of `string | null`.

These diagnostics are enabled as warnings by default, but this can be configured in the `tsconfig.json` like so:

```jsonc
{
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "extendedDiagnostics": {
      // The categories to use for specific diagnostics.
      "checks": {
        // Maps check name to its category.
        "invalidBananaInBox": "suppress"
      },

      // The category to use for any diagnostics not listed in `checks` above.
      "defaultCategory": "error"
    }
  }
}
```

Allowed categories for a diagnostic are `warning` (default), `error`, or `suppress`. `warning` emits the diagnostic but allows the compilation to succeed, `error` *will* fail the compilation, while `suppress` will ignore the diagnostic altogether.

The initial release has two diagnostics, and we are hoping to expand this longer term to add more diagnostics and provide additional insight into Angular templates to detect and surface developer mistakes *before* hours of debugging are wasted.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [X] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Docs are included in #44704.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [X] Feature

## What is the current behavior?

Extended diagnostics are gated on a private `_extendedTemplateDiagnostics` flag in `tsconfig.json`.

Issue Number: #42966.

## What is the new behavior?

Extended diagnostics are now enabled by default. This includes two existing diagnostics: `invalidBananaInBox` and `nullishCoalescingNotNullable`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [X] No

This will enable two new extended diagnostics as warnings. Existing users may see new warnings as a result, but no builds should fail as a result, so this is not considered a breaking change. Users may disable specific (or all) diagnostics via the above `tsconfig.json` configuration.

## Other information

Issues.Title: Update example code due to deprecations in RxJS
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

In documentation in example codes there are many usages of RxJS.
Several functions are going to be deprecated or already deprecated and will be removed in next major release.

For example in developer guide for HTTP Client, interceptors part ([Logging request and response pairs](https://angular.io/guide/http#logging-request-and-response-pairs)) the following code-snippet with tap-function uses deprecated form of the tap:

```
...
tap(
  // Succeeds when there is a response; ignore other events
  event => ok = event instanceof HttpResponse ? 'succeeded' : '',
  // Operation failed; error is an HttpErrorResponse
  error => ok = 'failed'
),
...
```

The deprecation note for the function used: "Instead of passing separate callback arguments, use an observer argument. Signatures taking separate callback arguments will be removed in v8. Details: https://rxjs.dev/deprecations/subscribe-arguments"

See more for details: https://rxjs.dev/api/operators/tap

### Proposed solution

The replacement of the provided snippet by the following:

```
...
tap({
  next: event => ok = event instanceof HttpResponse ? 'succeeded' : '',
  error: error => ok = 'failed'
}),
...
```

### Alternatives considered

No alternatives.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Update example code due to deprecations in RxJS" (#44708)

Issues.Title: Static files are not loaded from wwwroot
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have created a new Visual Studio project template with Angular and individual authentication.

If I try to load files from wwwroot, even if it is about css files, js files, images or even translation json files in the assets/i18 folder, they do not load. It seams it is a problem with the proxy configuration because not even the favicon.ico wouldn't load, but if I put the route in the proxy.config.js file, it works:
```js
const { env } = require('process');

const target = env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT ? `https://localhost:${env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT}` :
  env.ASPNETCORE_URLS ? env.ASPNETCORE_URLS.split(';')[0] : 'http://localhost:45299';

const PROXY_CONFIG = [
  {
    context: [
      "./css",
      "./js",
      "./plugins",
      "./images",
      "/favicon.ico",
      "/weatherforecast",
      "/error",
      "/account",
      "/_configuration",
      "/.well-known",
      "/Identity",
      "/connect",
      "/ApplyDatabaseMigrations",
      "/_framework"
   ],
    target: target,
    secure: false
  }
]

module.exports = PROXY_CONFIG;
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

the problem persists with every VS 2022 Angular project with Individual Authentication

Issues.Title: Project setup is not starting after Routing and Stylesheet selection
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Nothing is happening after I've selected the routing as "No" and stylesheet as "CSS". No error is shown in the terminal and even after waiting for more than30 minutes nothing is happening. (Screenshot attached
![Angular Project Setup Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18526842/149714309-617b48e5-8a2b-4de3-8aae-af67c8e5f906.png)
)

I'm following the steps mentioned in: https://angular.io/guide/setup-local


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
No exception shown on the screen
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.1.3
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.1.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1301.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         13.1.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   13.1.3 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          13.1.3 (cli-only)
```


### Anything else?

Please find the Node and NPM versions below.

Node version: v16.13.2

NPM version: 8.1.2

Operating system : Windows 11 Home Single Language
Operating system version : 22000.434
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Project setup is not starting after Routing and Stylesheet selection" (#22514)

Issues.Title: build: bump `.nvmrc` version
Issues.Body:
`@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin@5.9.1` requires at least `14.17.0`, so our current `.nvmrc` isn't up to date enough.

```
$ yarn --frozen-lockfile                                                                                                                                                                (master|âœ”)
yarn install v1.22.17
[1/5] Validating package.json...
[2/5] Resolving packages...
[3/5] Fetching packages...
error @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin@5.9.1: The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version "^12.22.0 || ^14.17.0 || >=16.0.0". Got "14.16.1"
error Found incompatible module.
```

Issues.Title: build: bump engine.io from 6.1.0 to 6.1.1
Issues.Body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) from 6.1.0 to 6.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.1.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

RangeError: Invalid WebSocket frame: RSV2 and RSV3 must be clear at Receiver.getInfo (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:176:14) at Receiver.startLoop (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:136:22) at Receiver._write (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:83:10) at writeOrBuffer (internal/streams/writable.js:358:12)

This bug was introduced by this commit, included in engine.io@4.0.0, so previous releases are not impacted.

Thanks to Marcus Wejderot from Mevisio for the responsible disclosure.

Bug Fixes

  • properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client (c0e194d)

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.0...6.1.1
  • Client release: -
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.1.1 (2022-01-11)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

RangeError: Invalid WebSocket frame: RSV2 and RSV3 must be clear at Receiver.getInfo (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:176:14) at Receiver.startLoop (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:136:22) at Receiver._write (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:83:10) at writeOrBuffer (internal/streams/writable.js:358:12)

This bug was introduced by this commit, included in engine.io@4.0.0, so previous releases are not impacted.

Thanks to Marcus Wejderot from Mevisio for the responsible disclosure.

Bug Fixes

  • properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client (c0e194d)
Commits
  • f3b761d chore(release): 6.1.1
  • c0e194d fix: properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client
  • b04967b refactor: import Node's setTimeout & clearTimeout to prevent ambiguity (#632)
  • See full diff in compare view

Issues.Title: ci: remove Node v10
Issues.Body:
Node v10 is no longer supported by the Node.js team and it is difficult to keep CI green when the NPM infrastructure underneath the CLI is no longer expected to maintain Node v10 support.

I noticed that we still have this job running in Angular v11 and it has consistently failed for some time.

Issues.Title: How to analyse anyComponentStyle exceeded maximum budget?
Issues.Body:
I'm coming across an issue where I am seeing the following warning/error when building a project.

`Error .scss exceeded maximum budget. Budget 4.00 kB was not met by 2.36 kB with a total of 6.36 kB.`

When serving my library via Storybook and checking the outputted CSS for each component they are well below the budget limit, but when trying to build an application that imports the library I get the error above.

Is there a way to correctly analyse the bundles to see what is being outputted? From what I can see the stats.json file ran through `webpack-bundle-analyzer` does not list any of the CSS produced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to analyse anyComponentStyle exceeded maximum budget?" (#22507)

Issues.Title: Fingerprint assets
Issues.Body:

# ðŸš€ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Angular CLI fingerprints the generated JS output (for example `main.d64e98daf9464b95.js`) which works great with aggressive cache strategies in a CDN.

In the other hand for assets such as images, [the recommended way of dealing with them](https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#assets-configuration) is to put them in a special folder which Angular CLI copies as-is when building the app. This means that there is no fingerprint and thus causes problems with CDNs cache, as can't know if the requested file changed since last request.

### Describe the solution you'd like

A way of fingerprinting assets such as images that works with Angular CLI.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We used to use some webpack tricks but none of them work by Angular CLI 13.1.

We also use a Service Worker but doesn't solve the problem: it does keep track of the changes and knows if a non-figerprinted resource changed (as it stores its hash in `ngsw.json`) BUT when it has changed and it's requested to the CDN, the CDN doesn't know about this and can't decide whether it can serve the cached version, or should request a fresh version of it. If it was fingerprinted, as they'd be different filenames, there would be no problems with the cache.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fingerprint assets" (#22510)

Issues.Title: Chrome/karma is started before the webpack dev server is ready to serve
Issues.Body:
# ðŸž Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... No, AFAIK, this has always been present ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... There is this issue in Karma: https://github.com/karma-runner/karma/issues/3745 What happens is that Angular CLI is starting karma and the webpack dev server at the same time. On large Angular projects, like ours, Angular + webpack is very slow (1-2 minutes to start `ng serve` for example, separate issue we really need to address somehow). What seems to occur is that chrome (or ChromeHeadless) gives up trying to load the page (it would see the problem that the server is not responding). Karma then kills the browser and restarts it (triggering issue https://github.com/karma-runner/karma/issues/3745). Eventually the webpack dev server starts responding, and the tests run. Once the tests complete, the coverage report (and potentially other reporters) fail to write their reports. While there is a bug in Karma that needs to be fixed, it does not seem to make sense to start the test framework until the webpack dev server is ready to serve the application. When it is ready, we see the `Browser application bundle generation complete` printed to the terminal. Ideally karma would be started after a 200 HTTP response could be obtained from the webpack dev server ## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Only thing that is required is to run `ng test` on an Angular project. The problem to reproduce is that the application has to have enough code to cause webpack dev server to be too slow to start before chrome gives up loading the page. ## ðŸ”¥ Exception or Error
## ðŸŒ Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 13.1.2
Node: 14.17.1
Package Manager: npm 6.14.13
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 13.1.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1301.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            13.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.1.2
@angular/cli                    13.1.2
@ngtools/webpack                13.1.2
@schematics/angular             13.1.2
ng-packagr                      13.1.2
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.5.4
webpack                         5.65.0
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: perf(cdkTextareaAutosize): Allow custom LineHeight computation strategies
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

_cacheTextareaLineHeight() runs at startup for every instance of cdkTextareaAutosize, despite the fact that for most applications, the line height value will be consistent and constant across the whole app, and frequently known at development time.

_cacheTextareaLineHeight() is a costly operation as it triggers css layout (measured at about 20ms per textarea in my app).

For most applications, it would be safe to compute the value only once and share between instances, and many other apps could just hardcode it.

See internal CL 421826236 for more context.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Bootstrap multiple textareas with cdkTextareaAutosize


### Expected Behavior

Developer is able to override default behavior of doing costly measurements of text line height on every instance

### Actual Behavior

No mechanism to override default behavior of doing costly measurements of text line height on every instance

### Environment

- Angular: 13
- CDK/Material: 13
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "perf(cdkTextareaAutosize): Allow custom LineHeight computation strategies" (#24211)

Issues.Title: perf(cdkTextareaAutosize): Skip height measurements when textarea value is empty
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Calls to _measureScrollHeight, which trigger css layout, are not needed when there's nothing in the text field. In this case, simply set the height to 1 row (height of one line).

See internal CL 421826236 for more context.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Bootstrap a textarea with cdkTextareaAutosize that has value of '' (empty)


### Expected Behavior

_measureScrollHeight() called only when there's a non-empty value.

### Actual Behavior

_measureScrollHeight() is called regardless of value.

### Environment

- Angular: 13
- CDK/Material: 13
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "perf(cdkTextareaAutosize): Skip height measurements when textarea value is empty" (#24210)

Issues.Title: CdkVirtualScrollViewport will not scroll past 266304 rows, no matter how many rows are in the array
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using the example project found at:
https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/examples#cdk-virtual-scroll-context

If one  increases the items array length to 1,000,000 elements, the virtual scroll viewport still renders and scrolls but will not scroll down past row number 266304. 
`export class CdkVirtualScrollContextExample {
  items = Array.from({length: 1000000}).map((_, i) => `Item #${i}`);
}`

This puts a hard cap on the size of dataset one can scroll through. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open in stackblitz the example found at https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/examples#cdk-virtual-scroll-context
2. Increase the size of the array for the data feeding the example to 1,000,000 elements
3. Attempt to scroll to the bottom.


### Expected Behavior

Expect to see Item # 1,000,000 at the bottom area of the virtual scrolling area.



### Actual Behavior

I see item # 266,304 at the bottom of the scrolling area, with the scrollbar all the way at the bottom. 

### Environment

- Angular: 13.0.0
- CDK/Material:13.1.2
- Browser(s): Brave, Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CdkVirtualScrollViewport will not scroll past 266304 rows, no matter how many rows are in the array" (#24208)

Issues.Title: feat(MatListItem): Add isDisabled method to MatListItemHarness
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

MatListItem supports the Input `disabled` but there is no easy way to test this. You have to know about the internals to test it.

`expect(await (await matListItemHarness.host()).getCssValue('pointer-events')).toBe('none')`

It would be nice to have a dedicated method like

`expect(await matListItemHarness.isDisabled()).toBeTruthy()`

### Use Case

This feature improves the test usability and hides implementation details.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatListItem): Add isDisabled method to MatListItemHarness" (#24200)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/scrolling): Virtual scrolling is broken in Chrome
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I am using the virtual scroll view `cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport`. I am in Chrome and the content is flickering at high-speed scrolling. It can be reproduced either through a trackpad or with an infinite scroll mouse wheel.

I slowed down the animation to make the issue more apparent:

![chrome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12844423/149255281-63a680e9-8eec-4f9f-93f3-aa9263b99905.gif)

This issue doesn't happen in Firefox:

![firefox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12844423/149255331-a53eb804-8b30-4368-bee5-508b5ba3f375.gif)

### Reproduction

Visit https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-k3hmzh?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

### Expected Behavior

The view should not flicker.

### Actual Behavior

The scrollview flickers

### Environment

- Angular: 12.2.15
- CDK/Material: 13.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 97.0.4692.71
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2020) with 2GHz i5 and 16GB memory
